message.body: Is it true you'll be here tomorrow??!? A que hora?!
I'll be coming in sunday
Aw. Well, see you soon then!
Unsure that i can attend your sunday performance. :(
Aw :-( I thought that might be the case. Well, soon then!
￼I thought I'd pass this along to someone who appreciates navel lint...
I'm glad my offerings please the lint connoisseur
That's a gold mine! You stake a claim on that! It's an endless roll of bubble wrap for yr index finger!
There's just....so much...varied texture, elongated shape...perfect.
￼Latest installment
Did you ever get a definitive answer about the jersey first law?
Well first off, that is yet another delectable linty treasure. And well, I really just need advice on how legit my claim for exemption from said law is. Do you think you would know such a a thing?
I'm looking at the law right now. Who are your new jersey employers?
Oh wow so you would be subject to the nj law.
Commission for the blind and visually impaired. I would be doing part time O&M work. So have to prove to a board of magistrates or similar ilk that I have a hardship and have to live in Philly.
Well, i'm looking at cases dealing with the law and I'm not seeing anything post-2011 or anything discussing exemptions

Right. They have exemption hearings every month, but I have no clue what a legitimate exemption looks like. I read one thing that said they granted exemption to 100% of cases brought to them in person, but they certainly deny a lot every month according t
Well, what do you need to show to prove residency? Depending on what they require, could you plausibly get a nj drivers license and a nj bank account?

I guess? My employer is the one who has the burden of ascertaining my residency so I just have to prove it to them. My friend offered me her address, but I was hoping I could just get out of it without pulling her into it.
Hold on -- im looking at the state regulations explaining residency
How long do you plan on working for the commission? You apparently have one year to relocate to nj...

Yea, I mean, I would work there as long as I live in Philly, and who knows how long that will be...so I also thought of just waiting to apply till next year and maybe we'll buy a house or something...I dunno....
The residency requirements look pretty rigorous. You could use your friend's address, but nj might inquire as to how much time you spend at that apt compared to your apt in philly.
Im looking for successful exemptions. Maybe the philadelphia job market is a hardship?

Right, I think I'd have to really move everything there and switch this lease to j. I'd rather try and exempt. Do you think my excuse of "my 'fiancee's' job has him working till 3 am and he can't afford a car" will work?
You could maybe spin it as financial hardship -- draft up a budget of your living expenses and illustrate why you cant move to nj right now
My other idea is "my theatre co uses my apt as rehearsal space and they don't have cars to get to no and I can't afford a separate studio"
Maybe? I couldn't find examples of successful ones. The only unsuccessful one I found was "taxes are higher in nj, I don't want to pay them"
That's pretty honest
In a good way
Maybe back it up with last year's tax forms?
And some statistics on philadelphia/nj cost of living?
Yea, I guess I could draft a budget showing how I need Jeremy's income to supplement and he can't move because of his job?
Maybe further supplement it with want ads or other source showing that philly doesnt have openings for people with your skill set
I would talk with your employer -- they probably have more insight that what we're gleaning from the internet
No prob!
No, she has no idea unfortunately. But there are no O&M jobs in Philly so I can say that...ok! Thank you do much for this!
Also: ￼
Ps how did you find your lunchmeat job? Maybe there's a dc equivalent?
My joy swells, knowing how yours must as well, with such a fruitful tree to pluck from!

Schlesinger associates is the one I use to find lunch meat and equivalent research groups. But look at the "etc" page on the DC CL and you should find some local ones. Or just search for Dc market research groups. Always pays around $100 and more if you c
Thnx
Wish i could make it to your party!
Amazing. Yr lint was the talk of the garden party.
￼Happy Friday!
! Small but compact, he portends concentrated efforts and success for my weekend endeavors!
￼Special edition parabola-shaped lint
Baby lint, in the wild ￼
He's lost. You must bring him home! Scoop him out with care!
Can't wait to see you guys! ￼
Space lint!!
I'm taking a train to philly at 12, will roll in at around 1:30
Yay! I'm at work all day, so will see you around 4!
Hope you made yr bus! 'twas lovely to see you as always!
Made my bus, had a blast this weekend!
A tiny wooly, lost in a wilderness of stars
